title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 28 May 2015 - XWiki
content:
<OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
03:43 <OSIMasson> has quit  
03:46 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
03:54 <OSIMasson> has quit

09:58 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <tmortagne> sdumitriu1: you can inject a mock that will be injected in the list  
09:59 <tmortagne> using mocker.registerMockComponent(SomeRole.class, "hint")  
09:59 <gdelhumeau\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <tmortagne> in other words List/Map injection works as usual during unit tests  
10:00 <tmortagne> s/you can inject /you can register /  
10:27 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <Trefex> has quit  
11:11 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:14 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:35 <gsmeria> has quit  
11:51 <Trefex> hey guys  
11:51 <Trefex> so is there some weird caching with those LANG stuff during apt-get ?  
11:55 <tmortagne> Trefex: I did not test this morninig and it works well with the following locale setup for me:  
11:55 <tmortagne> LANG=en\_US.UTF-8  
11:55 <tmortagne> LANGUAGE=en\_US:en  
11:55 <tmortagne> LC\_TIME=en\_US.UTF-8  
11:55 <tmortagne> LC\_COLLATE="en\_US.UTF-8"  
11:55 <tmortagne> LC\_MONETARY=en\_US.UTF-8  
11:55 <tmortagne> LC\_MESSAGES="en\_US.UTF-8"  
11:55 <tmortagne> LC\_PAPER=en\_US.UTF-8  
11:55 <tmortagne> LC\_NAME=en\_US.UTF-8  
11:55 <tmortagne> LC\_TELEPHONE=en\_US.UTF-8  
11:55 <tmortagne> LC\_IDENTIFICATION=en\_US.UTF-8  
11:55 <Trefex> tmortagne: it does  
11:55 <tmortagne> what does "locale" command gives you exactly ?  
11:55 <Trefex> however only if the locale is set BEFORE the apt is started  
11:55 <Trefex> if you abort the setup, set the locale, logout, and resume the install  
11:56 <tmortagne> I did not had to do anything special  
11:56 <Trefex> it will fail with what we saw yesterday  
11:56 <tmortagne> I tested that i ubuntu 15.04  
11:57 <Trefex> yeah it works if the locale is set before hand  
11:57 <Trefex> ah well, i guess i apologize for the fuss :S  
11:57 <Trefex> seems something strange is going on with apt  
11:57 <Trefex> and it doesn't take new settings or something if the install is aborted  
12:04 <tmortagne> Trefex: still we need to find a way for the installer to work with whatever locale is configured anyay  
12:04 <tmortagne> I was just surprise that it does not work for you with n\_US.UTF-8 when I have the same locale  
12:04 <tmortagne> s/n\_US.UTF-8/en\_US.UTF-8/  
12:05 <Trefex> Caused by: org.dom4j.DocumentException: Error on line 91 of document  : The reference to entity "Il" must end with the ';' delimiter. Nested exception: The reference to entity "Il" must end with the ';' delimiter.  
12:05 <Trefex> if i run the initializing now  
12:06 <tmortagne> Trefex: could you paste the whole thing somewhere  
12:06 <tmortagne> sounds like syntax error somewhere like the hibernate conf  
12:06 <Trefex> http://paste.ubuntu.com/11409066/  
12:07 <tmortagne> yep looks like there is an issue in the hibernate.cfg.xml for some reason, like 91  
12:07 <tmortagne> \*line  
12:08 <tmortagne> you can access it from /etc/xwiki/hibernate.cfg.xml  
12:09 <tmortagne> I guess someone introduced a regression in the hibernate conf file generator...  
12:09 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
12:09 <Trefex> property name="connection.password">v{|}PFF(&Il#</property>  
12:09 <Trefex> i guess my password is too secure!  
12:09 <tmortagne> hmm  
12:09 <Trefex> that is line 91  
12:10 <tmortagne> actually the issue is that the passord is not escaped when generating the XML  
12:10 <tmortagne> & should be XML escaped here probably  
12:10 <tmortagne> this bug is probably here since forever and we have the same on MySQL side probably, just that nobody ever tried to use a password with & in it I guess  
12:11 <Trefex> i'm here to please  
12:11 <Trefex> i blame lastpass password generator…  
12:11 <tmortagne> would be great if you could create a jira issue for it, searching how to escape XML in a bash script now...  
12:13 <tmortagne> hmm the problem is that I can't really execute this escaping, debconf directly use the template  
12:13 <tmortagne> the more I have to turn around debconf the more it feel like a hacky not finished system  
12:15 <Trefex> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-814  
12:15 <Trefex> maybe it's not the right component  
12:21 <ol-ow2> has quit  
12:25 <Trefex> tmortagne: i changed the password  
12:25 <Trefex> now the initializing seems to hang at 0%  
12:28 <Trefex> nvm  
13:07 <Slashman> has quit  
13:12 <silverdrop> has quit  
13:31 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <Trefex1> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <Trefex> has quit  
14:19 <Trefex1> i guess i'm a noob  
14:20 <Trefex1> now it seems that there are huuuge delays when loading the wiki after a restart  
14:20 <Trefex1> like it takes 2 mins using 6 cores  
14:21 <Trefex1> using apache2 in front via AJP connector  
14:22 <Trefex1> is this still the recommended settings for java ? http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Performances#HMemory  
14:24 <cjd> has quit  
14:27 <vmassol> Trefex1: yes this page is up to date  
14:28 <Trefex1> well these delays are not normal, still no page after 5 mins  
14:28 <Trefex1> i guess it could be related to some java options  
14:28 <vmassol> indeed that's nor normal  
14:28 <vmassol> \*not  
14:28 <Trefex1> JAVA\_OPTS="-server -Xms2048m -Xmx2048m -XX:MaxPermSize=196m -Dfile.encoding=utf-8 -Djava.awt.headless=true -XX:+UseParallelGC -XX:MaxGCPauseMillis=100"  
14:28 <Trefex1> i use these settings  
14:28 <Trefex1> is it too high ?  
14:28 <vmassol> try the standalone version to see if it works for you  
14:29 <vmassol> it's a nit high but shouldn't cause such a perf degradation IMO  
14:29 <vmassol> \*bit  
14:29 <Trefex1> i put it to 800 and will try again  
14:30 <Trefex1> could it be the LDAP timeout?  
14:30 <Trefex1> i activated LDAP but didn't configure it yet, wanted to use the LDAP plugin for that  
14:30 <tmortagne> did you try to login ?  
14:31 <Trefex1> if i would see a login page  
14:31 <tmortagne> LDAP auth is used only if you enter a login/pass  
14:31 <tmortagne> so I doubt that's the issue  
14:31 <tmortagne> maybe you have something already in a cookie or something  
14:31 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <tmortagne> do you have anything in the log ?  
14:32 <Trefex1> i have many of those 2015-05-28 12:30:53,631 [XWiki Solr index job thread] WARN  o.x.j.i.DefaultJobProgress     - StepProgressEvent was fired too many times: [718] instead of [700]. The number of times StepProgressEvent is fired must match the number of steps passed to PushLevelProgressEvent.  
14:32 <Trefex1> in catalina.out  
14:34 <Trefex1> connection timed out now  
14:34 <tmortagne> those are not a big deal, it's just solr indexer not properly handling it's progress  
14:34 <tmortagne> s/it's/its/  
14:34 <Trefex1> so once i got the connection timed out  
14:35 <Trefex1> when i refresh, the wiki loads instantly  
14:35 <Trefex1> but the connection timed out took 5 mins or more to trigger  
14:35 <tmortagne> for some reason the first page load took forever, hard to say exactly what could be the cause  
14:36 <Trefex1> seems to be reproducible  
14:36 <tmortagne> how fast is to create a new page ?  
14:36 <Trefex1> if i restart tomcat, CPU is high for 20 seconds, then useage goes to 0  
14:37 <Trefex1> and page is loading forever  
14:37 <tmortagne> it loads lots of document the first time, maybe for some reason the database connection is very slow  
14:37 <Trefex1> it's local  
14:38 <Trefex1> don't understand how it could be slow  
14:38 <tmortagne> me neither  
14:38 <Trefex1> jesus, what am i doing :S  
14:38 <Trefex1> but in this state, it's not useable  
14:38 <Trefex1> which combination did you guys test the most?  
14:38 <Trefex1> i'll simply use that then  
14:38 <Trefex1> Debian with MySQL?  
14:39 <tmortagne> we mostly use mysql but there is no reason to be so slow with pgsql  
14:40 <tmortagne> are you sure it's not just the very first request which is slow ?  
14:40 <Trefex1> well now it's 4 minutes, and still initializing at 0%  
14:40 <Trefex1> happens every time i restart tomcat  
14:41 <tmortagne> you mean it take 4 minutes before you get the initialization progress even starting ?  
14:41 <Trefex1> it takes 2 mins for the progress to start  
14:41 <Trefex1> then it gets stuck another 2-3 on 0%, and then it goes to connection timed out  
14:41 <tmortagne> then nothing to do with the database  
14:42 <Trefex1> then i do refresh in the browser, and boum it loads instantly  
14:42 <tmortagne> you won't have any progress anyway in that version  
14:42 <tmortagne> it's been broken  
14:43 <tmortagne> you just see it once the init is finished  
14:43 <tmortagne> XWIKI-12113  
14:44 <tmortagne> when you see the progress it means XWiki instance is initialized, then it start loading the first page  
14:44 <tmortagne> initialize XWiki is not something instant, but you are not supposed to restart Tomcat all the time either  
14:45 <Trefex1> i know it's not instant  
14:45 <Trefex1> but nothing is happening in htop either  
14:46 <tmortagne> a few minutes for the whole init and first page load sounds expected to me  
14:46 <Trefex1> on a fresh install?  
14:47 <Trefex1> ending in a connection timed out  
14:47 <tmortagne> depends a lot on the server  
14:47 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:47 <Trefex1> what specifically?  
14:47 <Trefex1> this is 6 vcores, 8 GB RAM, and so on  
14:48 <tmortagne> many thing, the init is loading a lot of document, reading lot of things on the filesystem, Solr has to populate the index the first time  
14:48 <tmortagne> you should let it run a bit and then try to see how restarts goes  
14:49 <Trefex1> i'll start from scratch, i have used 6.X before, and i never saw so long loading times  
14:49 <tmortagne> I agree that 5 minutes is a lot  
14:49 <Trefex1> especially since the init results in an error, not a successful load  
14:49 <Trefex1> even if it takes 10 mins or so  
14:50 <tmortagne> if you get an error you obviously have an issue anyway  
14:50 <Trefex1> connection timed out  
14:50 <Trefex1> is the error  
14:50 <Trefex1> and when i reload the page, then it's there  
14:51 <tmortagne> except for really profiling what is happening exactly I don't have much idea of what can be so slow in your case  
14:52 <tmortagne> I never use pgsql but I don't see what XWiki would be a lot slower with it than mysql  
14:52 <tmortagne> s/what/why/  
14:52 <Trefex1> http://pastie.org/private/bsdhtydhezxfmqrpreuzig  
14:52 <Trefex1> this is my setup instructions  
14:52 <Trefex1> there's nothing strange in there or?  
14:54 <tmortagne> I don't see anything special in there  
14:55 <Trefex1> i'll start from scratch  
14:55 <Trefex1> this time i try Debian 8  
14:55 <Trefex1> will change config line by line, restart tomcat and observe  
14:58 <msmeria> has quit  
15:07 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:38 <Trefex1> ok screw this  
15:38 <Trefex1> now i get a 404  
15:38 <Trefex1> seriously, am i incapable of installing xwiki today or what  
15:41 <Trefex1> i think cjd or so was mentioning yesterday  
15:41 <Trefex1> but is xwiki broken with Tomcat 8 ?  
15:41 <vmassol> I doubt that  
15:42 <vmassol> it would mean no webapp would work with tomcat  
15:42 <Trefex1> vmassol: 28-May-2015 13:40:02.267 SEVERE [localhost-startStop-1] org.apache.catalina.startup.ContextConfig.processContextConfig Parse error in context.xml for /xwiki  
15:42 <Trefex1>  org.xml.sax.SAXParseException; systemId: file:/etc/tomcat8/Catalina/localhost/xwiki.xml; lineNumber: 31; columnNumber: 27; Error at (31, 27) : org.apache.naming.resources.FileDirContext  
15:42 <vmassol> this means your context.xml is no valid...  
15:43 <vmassol> you can enable debug mode for tomcat  
15:43 <Trefex1> i didn't even touch that file  
15:43 <vmassol> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationTomcat#HSEVERE:ErrorlistenerStart for ex  
15:43 <vmassol> it's possible your pb is with the deb install, I've never used it myself so I don't know  
15:45 <Trefex1> it's a bit funnny thought that i'm not able to do it, from a clean box, using the instructions  
15:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: would be nice if you could try installing xwiki on tomcat8 with the deb install to check that it works  
15:45 <Trefex1> maybe i'm just an idiot :(  
15:45 <vmassol> I  can't help you  
15:45 <Trefex1> i know  
15:45 <vmassol> if you use the WAR way I can help  
15:45 <vmassol> just setup your container the way you want  
15:45 <vmassol> and deploy the WAR in it  
15:45 <Trefex1> yeah i thought i wouldn't have to dig into tomcat, but i geuss i have to  
15:46 <vmassol> otherwise you need tmortagne's help  
15:46 <vmassol> well  
15:46 <vmassol> you could enable debug as I mentioned  
15:46 <vmassol> and tell us the error  
15:46 <vmassol> once we have the error it should be easy to fix it  
15:48 <vmassol> is this the context file you have: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-installers/xwiki-enterprise-installer-debian/xwiki-enterprise-installer-debian-tomcat/xwiki-enterprise-installer-debian-tomcat-common/src/deb/resources/etc/xwiki/xwiki-tomcat.xml ?  
15:49 <Trefex1> vmassol: yes that the one  
15:50 <vmassol> can you pastebin the full error you get?  
15:51 <vmassol> seems related to https://www.mail-archive.com/debian-bugs-dist%40lists.debian.org/msg1280086.html  
15:52 <vmassol> "I was looking through tomcat documentation and the class mentioned there  
15:52 <Trefex1> vmassol: http://paste.debian.net/185679/  
15:52 <vmassol> so indeed it seems the deb packaging doesn't work in tomcat8  
15:52 <vmassol> would be nice if you could cr@eate a jira issue  
15:52 <Trefex1> haha i don't want to create issues, i want to have a working instlal :D  
15:53 <vmassol> yep: "java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.naming.resources.FileDirContext"  
15:53 <Trefex1> snief  
15:55 <vmassol> it seems that tmortagne nor anyone else hasn't validated the deb install on tomcat8  
15:55 <vmassol> if you wanté to be safe, just used tomcat7 as we already suggested yesterday :)  
15:56 <Trefex1> ahhhhh  
15:56 <vmassol> but please open a jira issue for this  
15:56 <vmassol> since it would be nice to have xwiki work on tomcat8! :)  
15:56 <Trefex1> at this point it would be nice to have anything working :D  
15:56 <Trefex1> but that's my problem  
15:59 <Trefex1> k issue created vmassol  
15:59 <Trefex1> meantime i'll purge the packagees and start from scratch again  
16:00 <vmassol> thanks Trefex1!  
16:02 <Trefex1> is the WAR method easy?  
16:02 <Trefex1> at this point i'm tempted...  
16:07 <vmassol> you have 2 options:  
16:07 <vmassol> - use tomcat 7  
16:07 <vmassol> - use the WAR install  
16:08 <vmassol> since we recommend tomcat7 ATM I'd suggest you continue with deb but with tomcat7  
16:08 <vmassol> is that even possible or is the version of tomcat fixed?  
16:09 <vmassol> re war install: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationWAR  
16:11 <Trefex1> it's possible  
16:13 <Trefex1> do you use Jenkins for buiéding?  
16:14 <vmassol> yes  
16:14 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org  
16:15 <vmassol> gdelhumeau\_\_: could you check http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-wiki-test-tests/1384/testReport/ ?  
16:16 <gdelhumeau\_\_> again this flickr  
16:20 <woshilapin> has quit  
16:37 <Trefex1> :S  
16:42 <vmassol> has quit  
16:43 <Trefex1> tomcat7 also doesn't work  
16:43 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:43 <Trefex1> vmassol: can't get tomcat7 to work either on Debian 8  
16:43 <vmassol> :(  
16:44 <Trefex1> can't even get to the installer  
16:44 <Trefex1> stuck at initializing 12% since 10 mins  
16:47 <Trefex1> also is it normal that tomcat is not listening on TCP on 8080  
16:47 <Trefex1> but only on TCP6?  
16:48 <vmassol> no idea  
16:48 <tmortagne> Trefex1: as far as I can see TCP6 means TCP on IPV6, does not have anything to do with the port  
16:50 <Trefex1> so tomcat shouldn't bind on ipv4 on port 8080 ?  
16:51 <tmortagne> depends of your system and tomcat setup I guess  
16:51 <tmortagne> XWiki does not setup Tomcat it just register itself as servlet  
16:51 <Trefex1> out of the box Debina 8  
16:51 <Trefex1> just tell me which distro to use  
16:51 <Trefex1> lol  
16:51 <tmortagne> never used Debian 8 myself so I can't really tell you how it's supposed to be by default  
16:56 <Trefex1> so what distro you do most tests on?  
16:56 <Trefex1> Ubuntu 14?  
16:56 <Trefex1> Cent, Fedora, RHEL?  
16:58 <tmortagne> what I know better is Ubuntu, but xwiki.org and myxwiki.org are on debian AFAIK but I'm not really xwiki.org adminin sys  
17:00 <tmortagne> but the system is not supposed to change many things from XWiki point of view  
17:00 <Trefex1> well apparently i'm unable to install it for two days, while i did it in the past, so something is wrong, anyway, already taking too much of your time  
17:01 <Trefex1> i'll redeploy on Ubuntu 14 then, with Tomcat 7 and version 7.0.1  
17:02 <Trefex1> then i don't know anymore  
17:04 <gdelhumeau\_\_> Trefex1: have you checked the logs?  
17:05 <gdelhumeau\_\_> sorry, I've just seen  
17:05 <Trefex1> gdelhumeau\_\_: yeah, in the logs there's nothing, it just seems that it takes an insane amount to process the requests  
17:05 <Trefex1> i don't ge tit  
17:05 <Trefex1> get\*  
17:05 <gdelhumeau\_\_> FYI: on my Ubuntu Server LTS, with tomcat7 from apt-get, it just work  
17:06 <Trefex1> i'll do that now, Ubuntu 14.04 LTS  
17:06 <Trefex1> do you use Apache2 as front?  
17:06 <gdelhumeau\_\_> http://gdelhumeau.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Blog/Installing+XWiki+on+a+VPS  
17:06 <gdelhumeau\_\_> http://gdelhumeau.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Installing+XWiki+on+a+VPS  
17:06 <gdelhumeau\_\_> on xwiki.org it is apache2  
17:07 <gdelhumeau\_\_> on my server it's nginx  
17:07 <Trefex1> i will try with debian package  
17:07 <Trefex1> should work ?
